data.title: Fix Gwt stack trace, see #3753
data.body:
Continuation of #3753 
See http://stackoverflow.com/a/18408831
and http://proofbyexample.com/sneakythrow-avoid-checked-exceptions.html

**Looks like there are other problems with the stack trace on GWT, so please don't merge now***

data.title: fix gwt isButtonPressed
GWT isButtonPressed is wrong.
data.body:
After trying right button calls it just check for left button.  It will always return true if you check if button is left first. 

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backends-gwt/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/gwt/GwtInput.java#L170

data.title: RoboVM: iOS Release builds crashes in rare cases with NPE on non null final instances
Add polygon intersection method.
data.body: As mentioned in issue #3632 this adds a new Intersector method to determine the overlapping area between two polygons.

data.title: Add binormal and tangent to MeshBuilder
data.body: Allows vertex transformation to handle tangent and binormal correctly.

data.title: Fix Desktop IME input.
data.body:
Typing with IME only receives a unicode character without keydown event, so I added a KeyChar check.

Note: I only tested it in Windows 7, not sure if it works in other systems.

data.title: GWT sendHttpRequest doesn't work with Content-Type: multipart/form-data
data.body:
Hi,
Sending a request with this content-type only works on desktop (not tested on Android and iOS) but doesn't work on gwt (superDev and dist too).

What happens:
- The request is received by the php server but $_POST variable is empty
- handleHttpResponse returns with statusCode=0 and a 0 length string in getResultAsString

I join in attachment:
- the code to reproduce the issue (created from a new libGDX project that only contains the badlogic.jpg ressource in the core\assets directory, desktop and html project checked only)
- the index.php file to test the request received (in the code constant SERVER_URL as to be filled with the url where you'll install the php file)

So here's the php file:

[index.txt](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/100728/index.txt)

Here are the results:
- desktop
  TestMultipartPost: handleHttpResponse - OK
  TestMultipartPost: response.length=62
  TestMultipartPost: response={"TestMultipartPost":"COPY !","Key1":"Value1","Key2":"Value2"}
- gwt
  TestMultipartPost: handleHttpResponse - OK
  TestMultipartPost: response.length=0
  TestMultipartPost: response=

And here's the code:

[TestMultipartPost.txt](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/100729/TestMultipartPost.txt)

data.title: Gdx.input.getX() does not return the last pointer coordiante
data.body:
The comment on the method says:

```
/** @return The x coordinate of the last touch on touch screen devices and the current mouse position on desktop for the first
     *         pointer in screen coordinates. The screen origin is the top left corner. */
    public int getX ();
```

But when tested, getX() does not return the Last touch as it says it will.

Steps to reproduce.

1) Have a code that outputs Gdx.input.getX() on every frame
2) press somewhere on the left side of the screen with one finger, loop will start outputting small number
3) while holding prev finger press on the right side of the screen. because it's the latest touch, then getX should start returning a bigger number, but instead it still returns the coordinate of prev finger.

Is there something wrong I am doing?

I was trying to avoid this, by using  something like getX(pointer), but I also see no way to get what was the "last" pointer. I was looking if there was a method that I can use to retrieve a current last pointer when the justTouched is true, but could not find anything similar as well. Now I am kind of forced to implement code to keep track of pointers and see which one got "dissapeared" or "appeared" to be sure which one is last. But this seems like a wrong way to do it.

data.title: Running a game on an extended desktop
data.body:
Is it possible to (automatically) launch a LibGdx app that spans an extended monitor with 2 (or more) monitors?

I have a workaround that creates 2 separate windows using the new LWJGL3 backend but this presents some challenges of its own.
1. The game logic is now split across two different applications.
2. Additional "wiring" is required for communicating between both windows.

data.title: Lifecycle listener not called when a Timer is used
data.body: The [Timer.TimerThread](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/utils/Timer.java#L289) class removes itself as listener in the `dispose` method, which is called in an [enhanced for loop](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidGraphics.java#L477-L479) in `AndroidGraphics` . This causes the next lifecycle listener in the array not to be called.

data.title: FreeType - Allow configuration of hinting algorithm
data.body: With some fonts, the default FreeType hinter is too aggressive and yields poor results. This commit adds a field to `FreeTypeFontParameter` for configuring the hinting algorithm.

data.title: Fix broken kerning for freetype fonts
data.body:
When rendering true type fonts, I was seeing this:

![kerning_nok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/278476/12484184/c9f4dff8-c061-11e5-89bb-08c723ddeaa6.png)

instead of:

![kerning_ok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/278476/12484190/cf655710-c061-11e5-92e2-8056008fec5f.png)

Turns out the `FreeTypeFontGenerator` was generating incomplete kerning info. Before kerning, the library creates glyphs in order from highest to lowest for best packing. During this step, the `characters` array becomes corrupted (highest chars get discarded). For example: `['A', 'V', 'L', 'T', 'Y']` turns into `['T', 'T', 'L', 'T', 'Y']`, so `'A'` and `'V'` will not be considered for kerning.

This fix keeps the `characters` array sorted and intact for kerning purposes.

data.title: BitmapFont draws out of bounds when first character has negative xoffset
"You have a more recent version of android build tools" warning is not well explained
data.body:
I am not native english speaker, and I donÂ´t really know what this actually means:
When I create a new project with `gdx-setup.jar` and I click `Generate`, the application tells me I have a more recent version:

`You have a more recent version of android build tools than the recommended.`
`Do you want to use this version?`

What does `this` refer to? Already selected version? New version? 
IMHO, this should be rewritten to better explain this.

Sorry for disturbing you.

This fix makes full stack working.

data.title: GWT fix.
data.body: Fixed a issue when loading a model. (by @xoppa )

data.title: Add handling of <objectgroup> in <tile> in the com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled package
data.body:
Since version 0.10 of Tiled, _objectgroup_ blocks can be found in _tile_ blocks.

http://doc.mapeditor.org/reference/tmx-changelog/
http://doc.mapeditor.org/reference/tmx-map-format/

This is where custom collision shapes are stored on tiles. The libgdx implementation just ignored those blocks.

This commit ads a _getObjects()_ method on _TiledMapTile_ interface.

I had to change the _BaseTmxMapLoader_'s _loadObject_ signature in order to avoid code duplication and reuse the existing object parser.

data.title: Gdx-setup: add support for external dependencies
data.body:
This PR allows to add external dependencies for extensions defined in `extensions.xml`. Currently there is no way to do it, declared dependencies can't have version specified (it's inherited from extension version). Why is this change needed? Mostly for GWT, sometimes dependencies have separate gwt library which should be only included in html module and thus can't be included in extension itself. This was also discussed [here](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/3537#issuecomment-156844608) and would help avoid issues like #3737.

External dependcies are declared like this:

``` xml
<dependency external="true">net.onedaybeard.artemis:artemis-odb:1.2.1:sources</dependency>
```

`external="true"` is added to standard declaration.

I also corrected mixed indention in `extensions.xml`.

data.title: Get result when calling super in keyDown for later return.
data.body: Due to not handling the super result in TextArea the key was passed to my parent dialog causing the dialog to close when the ENTER key was enter in the textarea. This is a pull request to fix that bug.

data.title: Updated gdx-kiwi and gdx-lml extensions versions.
Feature Request. Using AssetManager to load Local files on Android
data.body: Currently AssetManager loads Internal files on Android automatically. It would be nice to load assets from Local files. For example generated fonts that were saved as Local files.

data.title: FrameBuffer doesn't reset viewport correctly in HDPI mode on LWJGL 3
data.body:
When using the `FrameBuffer` with LWJGL 3 on an HDPI device, the viewport is not correctly set after `end()` is called after the `FrameBuffer` is used.

Example code available at: https://gist.github.com/thomasleese/e6ab52efd2118adff696 or https://github.com/thomasleese/libgdx-framebuffer-test.

See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3673#issuecomment-172457359 for related conversation.

data.title: Use more lenient casts to prevent crash
data.body: Fixes #3744.

data.title: 1.8.0: Hiero crashing in batch mode
data.body:
Running it in batch mode from `desktop/build.gradle` like this:

```
task fonts(type: JavaExec) {
  classpath = sourceSets.main.runtimeClasspath
  main = "com.badlogic.gdx.tools.hiero.Hiero"
  args = ["--batch", "--input", "../fonts/azoft-sans.hiero", "--output", "android/assets/azoft-sans.fnt"]
}
```

Stack trace:

```
Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Float cannot be cast to java.lang.Double
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.hiero.Hiero.updateFont(Hiero.java:303)

    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
    at java.security.ProtectionDomain$JavaSecurityAccessImpl.doIntersectionPrivilege(ProtectionDomain.java:76)
```

The fix should be easy enough. I'll send a PR.

data.title: 3d particles doesn't play nice with other transparent renderables
data.body:
As you can see in the screenshot below, sometimes 3d particles are not draw behind semi transparent renderables. 

It seems that the particles renderable `worldTransform` field is never updated with the particles position. Therefore `DefaultRenderableSorter` can't sort the renderables properly and the particles aren't rendered when they are behind another renderable.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3535019/12379874/fb74c2ec-bd63-11e5-815d-415106425d8e.png)

data.title: Bug. AssetManager doesn't decrement the variable toLoad on asset load failed.
Add Bullet k-DOP and occlusion culling test
data.body:
Occlusion culling is a camera frustum culling technique which calculates not only whether an object is inside the frustum, but also if it is visible from the point of view of the camera.

k-DOP culling (k-Discrete Oriented Polytope) is a more conventional frustum culling, which uses the broadphase bounding volume tree to accelerate the culling. In this way, not all objects in the world need to be checked whether or not they are inside the frustum.

Demo: http://youtu.be/c1ncEbdDRvo

(Resubmission of #3730, I could not figure out how to squash the commits correctly when branches diverged...)

data.title: Typo explicitely instead of explicitly
data.body:
This is in a few files https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=explicitely

I don't have time to issue a patch at this minute with the Jam and all, but I can do it afterwards.
